summary: This document is an email chain from December 17, 2019, between federal prosecutors and an FBI agent, discussing defense requests related to the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death in the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The emails focus on requests from the attorney for inmate Nicholas Tartaglione for evidence, including video footage, photos, and the rope from the July 22/23, 2019 incident involving Epstein.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Inmate at the MCC whose defense attorney is making requests for evidence related to the July 22/23 incident involving Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Barket
persons.context: Attorney for Nicholas Tartaglione who is requesting to inspect evidence, including the orange rope from the Epstein incident.

connections.description: Barket is identified as the defense counsel making evidence requests on behalf of inmate Nicholas Tartaglione.

events.title: Epstein/Tartaglione Cell Incident
events.description: An incident occurred in the cell shared by Jeffrey Epstein and Nicholas Tartaglione at the MCC. The defense is requesting video and evidence from this date.

events.title: Video Evidence Request
events.description: The prosecution requested video footage from the MCC related to the July 22/23 incident, but were told it was not available as it had been overwritten.

events.title: Defense Conference
events.description: A conference was scheduled for the next day (December 18, 2019) regarding the Tartaglione case, prompting the defense's evidence requests.

keyFacts: The defense for inmate Nicholas Tartaglione requested video footage from the hallway outside his and Jeffrey Epstein's cell for July 22/23, 2019.
The MCC's video retention policy was cited as a reason the requested July 22/23 footage was not available; video from August 10 was also requested but reportedly overwritten.
The defense also requested to inspect the 'orange rope' from the July 22/23 incident, which the prosecution had not preserved.
The email discusses whether an After Action Report was prepared by the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) regarding Epstein's suicide.
The correspondence involves a 'Co-Chief, Narcotics Unit' from the U.S. Attorney's Office and an FBI Special Agent, indicating inter-agency coordination on the case.
